layout.subtitle: Educational dashboard on water stress in Chile
layout.footer: Open educational resource. Data shown is illustrative.

home.title: Understand water stress in Chile
home.intro: This bilingual dashboard helps students explore how water availability and demand change across Chile. Use the map to compare regions and indicators over time.

explore.title: Explore the map
explore.description: Select a region, basin, year, and index to visualize trends. Use the map and charts to discuss how water stress varies.

chart.empty: No data available for this selection

explore.error: We could not load the data. Please try again.

learn.title: Learn the concepts
learn.intro: Discover key ideas about water stress, water balance, and how indicators help us understand risks.

stress.title: Water stress
stress.text: Happens when demand approaches or exceeds the available supply.

balance.title: Availability vs demand
balance.text: Water balance compares inputs (rain, snow) with outputs (uses and losses).

drought.title: Drought
drought.text: A period of below-average precipitation that can reduce supply.

basin.title: River basin
basin.text: An area where all water drains to the same river or lake.

definitions.index: A numeric indicator that summarizes information about water stress or drought.
definitions.region: Administrative area used in the dashboard to group data.
definitions.basin: Hydrological unit where water drains to the same outlet.
definitions.trend: Direction of change over time (increasing, stable, decreasing).

quiz.title: Quick quiz
quiz.feedback_correct: Correct! More demand with limited supply raises stress.
quiz.feedback_wrong: Not quite. Think about how supply and demand interact.

WATER_STRESS.label: Water Stress Index
WATER_STRESS.description: Estimates pressure on water resources compared to availability.

DROUGHT_RISK.label: Drought Risk
DROUGHT_RISK.description: Likelihood of drought conditions affecting water supply.
